fields.name: getArticle
fields.description:
Get an article by id.
- version can optionally be used find a specific version, if empty latest version is retrieved.
- published can optionally be used to retrieve the latest version (regardless
any status if false) or the latest published version (if true).
This operation can be performed anonymously

args.name: published
args.description: if no version passed, retrieve the latest version (regarless the status) or the latest published version only.

fields.name: getArticleProof
fields.description:
Generate an article proof for a given article version
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: getArticleTransfers
fields.description:
Get Article transfers for a given recipient user account with pagination and sorting.
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: getCollection
fields.description:
Get a collection by ID
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: getComment
fields.description:
Get a paginated list of comments for a given resource.
This operation can be performed anonymously.

fields.name: getCommunity
fields.description:
Get a community by ID.
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: getCommunityContent
fields.description:
Get community curated content list with filter, sorting and pagination.
This operation can be performed anonymously.

fields.name: getCommunityInvitations
fields.description:
Get community invitations list with filter, sorting and pagination.
This operation can only be performed by a community ADMIN.

fields.name: getLatestHomepageDescriptor
fields.description:
Get the Homepage schema descriptor with the ability to fetch and populate the homepage schema
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: getMyProfile
fields.description:
Retrieve user profile (public and private information) corresponding to the token.
This operation can only be performed by a logged user.

fields.name: getTemplates
fields.description: Get article templates for a given context

args.name: context
args.description: Defines contextual elements of an article used by template logic

fields.name: getUser
fields.description:
Retrieve a user profile (public information only).
This operation can be performed anonymously.

fields.name: prepareAcceptInvitation
fields.description:
Accept an invitation (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a logged user in possession of the invitation secret

fields.name: prepareChangeMemberRole
fields.description:
Change a member role within the community (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

fields.name: prepareCreateCommunity
fields.description:
Create a community (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a logged user

args.name: invitations
args.description: List of invitations to send after the community is created

fields.name: prepareRemoveMember
fields.description:
Remove a member from the community (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: account
args.description: Member User ID to remove from the community

fields.name: prepareRevokeInvitation
fields.description:
Revoke a pending invitation (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

fields.name: prepareSendInvitation
fields.description:
Send an invitation to join te community (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

fields.name: prepareSendInvitationBatch
fields.description:
Send invitations (batch) to join te community (prepare call, return a meta-tx hash to sign).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

fields.name: resource
fields.description:
Generic operation to retrieve a resource by id.
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: resources
fields.description:
Generic operation to retrieve a list resources by ids.
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: searchArticles
fields.description:
Search articles with pagination, sorting and filters.
This operation can be performed anonymously

args.name: sort
args.description: Sorting attribute (dateCreated, authorId, ownerId, articleVersion, title, content)

fields.name: searchAutocomplete
fields.description:
Perform a parametrized global search query with autocomplete, pagination, sorting and filtering
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: searchCollections
fields.description:
Search collections with pagination, sorting and filters.
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: searchCommunities
fields.description:
Search communities with pagination, sorting and filters.
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: searchMoreLikeThis
fields.description:
Perform a parametrized global search query to find related resources with pagination, sorting and filtering
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: searchTags
fields.description:
Search tags
This operation can be performed anonymously

fields.name: searchUsers
fields.description:
Search user profile (public information only) with pagination, sorting and filter.
This operation can be performed anonymously.

fields.name: views
fields.description:
Get view count for a given resource.
This operation can be performed anonymously.

fields.name: voteResult
fields.description:
Get vote result for a given resource.
This operation can be performed anonymously.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: associatedNfts
fields.description: NFTs associated with this article

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: Set of optional attributes fields

fields.name: author
fields.description: Article author (full profile)

fields.name: authorId
fields.description: Author of the article (USER only)

fields.name: checkpoint
fields.description: Checkpoint file (null if the article is not escalated on-chain)

fields.name: comments
fields.description: Get a paginated list of comments for this article

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the article (most likely to be plain markdown text)

fields.name: contentHash
fields.description: IPFS Content hash

fields.name: contributors
fields.description:
Returns a list of contributors (PublicUserDTO) for this ArticleDTO
This operation can only be performed by logged user

args.name: published
args.description: Only users whose published revisions (no draft)

fields.description: Date created

fields.name: datePublished
fields.description: Date publication

fields.name: description
fields.description: Description of the article - First 500 characters of the plaintext content)

fields.name: owner

fields.name: ownerId
fields.description: Owner of the article (can be a USER or COMMUNITY)

fields.name: signature
fields.description: Signature from the author proving authorship: sha3(id, version, owner, contentHash, timestamp)

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the article

fields.name: tags

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of article

fields.name: updateComment
fields.description: The comment describing this version update of the article

fields.description: Article Version

fields.name: views
fields.description: Get views of this article

fields.name: voteResult
fields.description: Get vote result for the article

fields.name: acceptArticleTransfer
fields.description:
Accept an article transfer.
This operation can only be performed by the recipient of the transfer.

fields.name: acceptInvitation
fields.description:
Accept an invitation (execute call).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareAcceptInvitation (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: addCollectionResource
fields.description:
Add a resource into a section
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

args.name: position
args.description: Position of the resource in the section (default: last)

fields.name: addCollectionSection
fields.description:
Add a section to a collection
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: addComment
fields.description:
Add a comment on a resource
This operation can only be performed by a logged user.

fields.name: addTemplate
fields.description: Add an article template

fields.name: approveArticle
fields.description:
Approve a pending article version. If a non-owner publishes an article, the
article passes to a PENDING status, requiring an owner to approve/reject the version.
This operation can only be performed by the article owner

fields.name: approveResource
fields.description:
Approve a pending curated resource to a community.
This operation can only be performed by a communinity moderator or admin.

fields.name: cancelArticle
fields.description:
Delete one of your draft articles
This operation can only be performed by the article author

fields.name: cancelArticleTransfer
fields.description:
Cancel an article transfer in progress.
This operation can only be performed by the initiator of the transfer.

fields.name: changeMemberRole
fields.description:
Change a member role within the community (execute call).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareChangeMemberRole (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: checkpointArticles
fields.description:
Trigger the checkpointer to find non-checkpointed articles, organize them into a merkle tree and store the file on IPFS.
This operation can only be performed by logged user

fields.name: composeCollection
fields.description:
Compose a collection with sections and articles
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: createCollection
fields.description:
Create or Edit a collection
This operation can only be performed by logged user (create) or the collection owner (edit)

args.name: owner
args.description: Collection owner, can be a USER or COMMUNITY. by default sender

fields.name: createCommunity
fields.description:
Create a community (excute call).
This operation can only be performed by a logged user

args.name: invitations
args.description: List of invitations to send after the community is created

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareCreateCommunity (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: curateResources
fields.description:
Curate a resource to a community.
This operation can only be performed by a logged user (if performed by
community members, the resource is automatically approved and curated,
otherwise pending approval)

fields.name: deleteCollection
fields.description:
Delete a collection
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: editArticleVersion
fields.description:
Edit an existing draft article version
This operation can only be performed by the author of the article
This operation can only be performed during the DRAFT stage

args.name: content
args.description: Content of the article in mardown

args.name: description
args.description: Description paragraph of the article. if empty: 500 first characters of content used

fields.name: editCommunity
fields.description:
Edit a community.
This operation can only be performed by a community ADMIN

fields.name: finaliseArticleTransfer
fields.description:
Finalise an article transfer (publish a new version).
This operation can only be performed by the recipient of the transfer.

fields.name: initiateArticleTransfer
fields.description:
Initialise an article transfer.
This operation can only be performed by the article owner

args.name: recipient
args.description: Recipient of the transfer: USER or COMMUNITY

fields.name: moveCollectionResource
fields.description:
Move a resource within a section
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: moveCollectionSection
fields.description:
Move a section in a collction
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: publishArticle
fields.description:
Publish a draft article version.
This operation can only be performed by the author of the article

args.name: owner
args.description: Owner of the article. If empty: author is attributed as owner

fields.name: recordView
fields.description:
Record a view against a resource. A buffer prevents to record more than one view per IP and per hour and per resource.
This operation can be performed anonymously.

fields.name: regenerateEmailVerificationCode
fields.description:
Regenerate an email verification code
This operation can only be performed by a logged user.

fields.name: rejectArticle
fields.description:
Reject a pending article version. If a non-owner publishes an article, the
article passes to a PENDING status, requiring an owner to approve/reject the version.
This operation can only be performed by the article owner

fields.name: rejectArticleTransfer
fields.description:
Reject an article transfer.
This operation can only be performed by the recipient of the transfer.

fields.name: removeCollectionResource
fields.description:
Remove a resource from a section
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: removeCollectionSection
fields.description:
Remove a section from collection
This operation can only be performed by the collection owner.

fields.name: removeMember
fields.description:
Remove a member from the community (execute call).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: account
args.description: Member User ID to remove from the community

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareRemoveMember (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: removeResource
fields.description:
Remove an approved or pending curated resource from a community.
This operation can only be performed by a communinity moderator or admin.

fields.name: resendInvitation
fields.description:
Resend a pending invitation.
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: email
args.description: Email address to resend the invitation

fields.name: revokeInvitation
fields.description:
Revoke a pending invitation (execute call).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareRevokeInvitation (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: saveUser
fields.description:
Save user profile.
This operation can only be performed by a logged user.

fields.name: sendInvitation
fields.description:
Send an invitation to join te community (execute call).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareSendInvitation (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: sendInvitationsBatch
fields.description:
Send invitations (batch) to join te community (execute call).
This operation can only be performed by a community admin

args.name: signature
args.description: Signature of the hash return by prepareSendInvitationBatch (used to identified the sender through meta-tx)

fields.name: submitArticle
fields.description:
Submit an draft article
This operation can only be performed by logged user

args.name: content
args.description: Content of the article in mardown

args.name: description
args.description: Description paragraph of the article. if empty: 500 first characters of content used

args.name: id
args.description: Article ID. If present: generate a new version

args.name: version
args.description: Article Version. If present: edit an existing draft version

fields.name: submitArticleVersion
fields.description:
Submit a new article version
This operation can only be performed by logged user

args.name: content
args.description: Content of the article in mardown

args.name: description
args.description: Description paragraph of the article. if empty: 500 first characters of content used

fields.name: submitNewArticle
fields.description:
Submit a new article
This operation can only be performed by logged user

args.name: content
args.description: Content of the article in mardown

args.name: description
args.description: Description paragraph of the article. if empty: 500 first characters of content used

fields.name: subscribe
fields.description: Opt-in/Opt-out to a list of subscriptions (newsletter)

fields.name: updateHomepage
fields.description:
Update the homepage descriptor.
This operation can only be performed by a super admin.

fields.name: verifyEmail
fields.description:
Action to verify an email (open the verification link sent by email)
This operation can only be performed by a logged user.

fields.name: vote
fields.description:
Record a vote (+1/-1) against a resource. One vote allowed per user and per resource
This operation can only be performed by a logged user.

args.name: value
args.description: Value of the vote. upvote: +1, downvote: -1

fields.name: hash
fields.description: hash associated to the mutation/command sent. Should be used to subscribe to the event

fields.name: getEvent
fields.description:
Subscribe to events by hash (commandHash)
This operation can be performed anonymously

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email to send the community invitation

fields.name: role
fields.description: Role associated to the invitation

fields.name: secret
fields.description: A secret allowing the recipient to approve/reject an invitation

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
